intro: [WRONG START] Hieracium linahamamariense, commonly known as the Canary Islands groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its native habitat. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, and its leaves are usually hairy and lobed. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within the region.
